column4: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DataRecovery#Extract%20individual%20files%20from%20recovered%20image  can someone please help me with this?
i'm using vbox as well making it more tricky and 8.10 ubunut
sudo foremost -i /dev/hda -o /recovery/foremost  I don't have a /dev/hda
Can I please pm someone to help me recover some data?
pastebin the output of "mount" and we can help you further
are you running from livecd?
ok, i think a ss is helpful
which foremost command doesnt work for you?
you mentioned you were running a command with included addressing a hard disk, what command was this?
which exact command doesnt work? :-)
are the files to be recovered in the virtual machine you are running also the live-cd? or are they on the host == windows with vbox program?
(theres a scroll up and down line in the chat program)
does the live cd recognize the hd? f.e. does nautilus offer the disk to mount?
ok, one moment
so it would be sda (which i dont understand, because you said that it didnt work)
depends on how the foremost command works
step one is creating the usb..
i suggest creating a network file system location which you can mount instead of a usb location
shared folder on the host is not a real network file system i think, which means other could still work very well
btw did you say that sda worked for you?
alright, one moment

hmm, the question is, how can i setup network shares, which you could repost to the channel when things have calmed down a bit, they will give you a keyword (factoid) which i dont remember at this moment
dont know sorry, no relevant experience by myself..
just an idea: the wikipedia page of minitab provides alternative programs at the end of the page
